--- Kenneth Wilson <kdw21620@...> wrote:

> Hi all,
> 
> Picked this up from Germany.  It is a beautiful Mino
> Shakudo Tsuba.  I believe the kogai ana is filled
> with
> copper.  It has nice nanako.  The edge is completely
> filled with leaves and flowers,etc.  The only really
> weird thing is that the seppa-dai must have be put
> on
> a pole weapon or something.  It has notches put in
> and
> the nakaga ana has been widened.  Questions, where
> would you classify this?  I was thinking mid-edo, 
> but
> what would you look for in ko-mino work?   I have
> been
> looking for a piece like this for a long time and I
> think I did well on the purchase.  Comments please
> (good and bad). 
>
